5.23.19  1:02 am   it seems to me that most people at gyms that i have been to just care about the aesthetics of movement (both how you look while you are doing the exercises, and how it makes your body look), or they are there to be healthy in the future.

my feeling is that those are both good side effects of movement but maybe aren't the only reasons for movement. i think that movement spreads across everything we do as humans so if we try to simplify it to only aesthetics and/or health we miss all the other reasons why movement is absolutely essential and connected to life.


i have tried to explain this to some of my friends but they don't exactly get it or agree and in a way that makes me even more confident that i am onto something big but i just don't know how to explain it properly yet.

do you at least understand/agree with some of what i said here?
